title: Liquid Iron | Integrative Therapeutics®
description: Liquid Iron combines bisglycinate chelates with vitamin B12 and folic acid.
cleaned_text: Liquid Iron [](/products/liquid-iron) Liquid Iron Dairy Free | Vegan | Gluten Free [Log in](/account?locale=en) [View full details](/products/liquid-iron) Product information LIQUID IRON SUPPLEMENT TO SUPPORT ENERGY AND STAMINA* Vegetarians and women of child-bearing age may not get enough iron through diet alone. Liquid Iron is a convenient supplemental option that combines iron with vitamin B12 and folic acid. Supplementation with Liquid Iron helps form hemoglobin in red blood cells, which in turn supports energy and stamina.* LIQUID IRON SUPPLEMENT TO SUPPORT ENERGY AND STAMINA* Vegetarians and women of child-bearing age may not get enough iron through diet alone. Liquid Iron is a convenient supplemental option that combines iron with vitamin B12 and folic acid. Supplementation with Liquid Iron helps form hemoglobin in red blood cells, which in turn supports energy and stamina.* INGREDIENTS 10 Calories 2g Total Carbohydrate 0g Total Sugars -- Includes 0 g Added Sugars 2g Alcohol ferric glycinate) ** Daily Value (DV) not established Percent daily value is based on a 2000 calorie diet Other Ingredients Liquid Iron Does Not Contain Sugar Salt Gluten Corn Soy Dairy Colors Wheat Ingredients of animal origin Other Details UPC: 871791001558 SKU: 206004ET DIRECTIONS Liquid Iron Directions and/or DosageTake 1 teaspoon (tsp) daily with a meal, or as recommended by your healthcare professional. WarningAccidental overdose of iron-containing products is a leading cause of fatal poisoning in children under 6. Keep this product out of reach of children. In case of accidental overdose, call a doctor or Poison Control Center immediately. If you are pregnant, nursing, or taking prescription drugs, consult your healthcare professional prior to use. INTERACTIONS FAQS A: Most liquid supplements include directions for refrigeration upon opening and recommend closing the bottle cap tightly after each use. These practices help slow down oxidation reactions, which are associated with reduced stability and oftentimes, taste and texture alterations of liquid formulations. Fat soluble vitamins (A, D, E and K) and minerals, in particular, should be refrigerated to maintain stability.
